subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|s=这|alt=遮-archaic,者-archaic,只-archaic,拓-archaic,迓-Hakka:liá; yá,邇-Hakka:liá; yá,即-Hokkien:chit}}
First attested in the [[Tang]] Dynasty; etymology unclear. Proposed etymologies:
* From {{och-l|者|one which}} ({{zh-ref|Lü, 1985}}). {{zh-ref|Wang (1990)}} notes that {{zh-l|*者}} always occurs after what is referred to, where as {{lang|zh|這}} always before.
*: {{och-l|者|one which}} > {{ltc-l|者|this (''possessive case'')}} > {{ltc-l|者|this (''general demonstrative'')}} > {{cog|cmn|這|tr=zhè}}.
* From {{och-l|之|this; it}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1990}}). {{zh-ref|Norman (1988)}} notes that this derivation would be phonologically problematic.

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=zhè,zhèi
|m_note=zhèi - colloquial contraction of {{m|zh|這[[一]]|tr=zhèyī}}, used when it is followed by classifier or numeral + classifier
|m-s=ze4
|dg=җы3
|c=ze2,ze3,ze5
|c_note=ze3, ze5 - rare
|c-t=die1
|g=
|h=pfs=ché/n:liá/yá/ngiá;gd=gê3/ê3
|h_note=ché - literary; liá/yá, gê3/ê3 - may be etymologically unrelated to the Mandarin readings
|j=zeh4/zei3
|j_note=zei3 - determiner (contraction of {{m|zh|這[[一]]|tr=zeh4 ieh4}})
|md=ciē
|md_note=literary
|mn=xm,zz:ché/qz:chí/tw:che/chit/xm:chiá
|mn_note=ché/chí/che - pronoun (chí usually written as {{m|zh|只}}), may be etymologically unrelated to the Mandarin readings; chit - determiner (contraction of {{m|zh|這[[一]]}}), may be etymologically unrelated to the Mandarin readings; chiá - literary
|mn-t=zê2
|w=2tse,4tseq
|x=
|ma=y
|cat=pron,det,adv,part
}}

subSections.title: Etymology 2
subSections.text:
{{zh-forms|s=这}}
Original meaning of this character. It is part of the {{och-l|迎|to face, to meet}} word family; see there for more.
